question.name: Residence
question.text: Please provide your state (if in USA) or country (if outside USA)CR of residence.

question.name: Household Income
question.text: Please estimate your total yearly househould incomeCRbefore taxes (in USD).

question.name: Education Level
question.text: Please select your education level.

question.name: Study Areas
question.text: What were the primary areas of study (majors, research focuses, etc.)CR during your academic career? Please list all areas.

question.name: Systems Thinking Experience
question.text: Do you have any prior experience in systems thinking? If yes,CR where does this experience come from (classes, books, conferences, workCR experience, etc.)?

question.name: Volunteer Activities
question.text: Are you involved with any volunteer activities?

question.name: Computer Gaming
question.text: Please select your computer gaming background.

question.name: Myers Briggs Personality Type
question.text: Please select your Myers Briggs personality type, if known.

question.name: Big 5 - Openness to Experience
question.text: Please estimate your openness to experience. An individual who is highCR in openness to experience is likely someone who has a love of learning,CR enjoys the arts, engages in a creative career or hobby, and likes meetingCR new people. An individual who is low in openness to experience probablyCR prefers routine over variety, sticks to what he/she knows, and prefers lessCR abstract arts and entertainment.

question.name: Big 5 - Conscientiousness
question.text: Please estimate your conscientiousness. Someone who is high inCR conscientiousness is likely to be self-disciplined and organized. ACR person who is low in conscientiousness is more likely to be easy-going,CR to procrastinate, and to be impulsive.

question.name: Big 5 - Agreeableness
question.text: Please estimate your agreeableness. People high in agreeablenessCR tend to have few enemies, are sympathetic and affectionate to theirCR friends and loved ones, and are sympathetic to the plights of strangers.CR People low in agreeableness tend to have a more analytic and detachedCR personality and can be seen as competitive or argumentative.

question.name: Big 5 - Neuroticism
question.text: Please estimate your neuroticism. Those high in neuroticism are generallyCR given to anxiety, sadness, and worry. They may be temperamental, self-consciousCR or unsure of themselves. Individuals who score on the low end of neuroticismCR are more likely to feel confident, sure of themselves, and adventurous.

question.name: Big 5 - Extraversion
question.text: Please estimate your extraversion. People high in extraversion tend to seekCR out opportunities for social interaction. They are comfortable with others,CR gregarious, and prone to action rather than contemplation. People low inCR extraversion are more likely to be quiet, introspective, reserved, andCR thoughtful.

question.name: Learning Style
question.text: Please select your preferred learning styles, if any.

question.name: Occupational Area
question.text: Please provide your general area(s) of occupation (Ex: medicine,CR computer software, biology, elementary education, school administration,CR business management).

question.name: Current Position
question.text: Please provide your most relevant current and past position title(s)CR (Ex: Researcher, System Architect, Technical Lead, Distinguished Professor,CR Director of Technology, Competency Manager, etc.)

question.name: Current Job Duties
question.text: Please briefly provide your current job duties.

question.name: Career Background
question.text: Please provide the kinds of jobs you've held leading up to yourCR current position; e.g. your career progression up to the present.

question.name: Practice
question.text: After the introduction and practice exercise, do you feel likeCR you understand how to play the game?

question.name: Four Shapes
question.text: After observing all turns, you may have noticed that most of theCR shapes are sometimes gone. Why?

answerOptions.answerOption: The shapes did not move enough

question.name: Four Shapes
question.text: What makes a shape divide into two?

question.name: Four Shapes
question.text: What would most likely happen if the rain rate were increasedCR by a large amount?

answerOptions.answerOption: Shapes would shrink and possibly disappear

question.name: Four Shapes
question.text: What are they key things that make the spinning shapes move?

question.name: Four Shapes
question.text: Does this system remind you of any real life system?

question.name: Four Shapes
question.text: If you had to give the small red balls a name, what would you call them?

answerOptions.answerOption: I would not name them collectively

question.name: Four Shapes
question.text: Please briefly describe your strategy for this scenario.

question.name: Four Shapes
question.text: Are there any variables you wish you could have changed, but weren't available?

question.name: Four Shapes
question.text: If you could play this scenario over again, is there anything you would do differently?

question.name: Four Shapes
question.text: Is there anything that prevented you from doing your best?

question.name: Eight Shapes
question.text: Which of the following would you include as important parts of this system?

answerOptions.answerOption: Number of corners of a shape
Design of the program's user interface
The random seed that determines when and where rain drops appear
What you ate for dinner last night

question.name: Eight Shapes
question.text: Please briefly describe your strategy for this scenario.

question.name: Eight Shapes
question.text: If you could do this scenario over, is there anything you would do differently?

question.name: Eight Shapes
question.text: Do you feel that your gameplay style has changed since the first scenario? If so, how?

question.name: Chaos
question.text: What do you think the special trait for triangles is?

answerOptions.answerOption: Growth - They grow more from rain and balls
Defense - They take less damage from stars
Offense - They take size from other shapes faster
Movement - They move faster than other shapes

question.name: Chaos
question.text: If a large shape, rapidly spinning left (counter-clockwise), wereCR introduced to the system, what do you think would happen to it overCR time?

answerOptions.answerOption: It would stay the same size

question.name: Chaos
question.text: What does the color of a spinning shape mean?

answerOptions.answerOption: It determines how fast a shape grows
It determines how fast a shape moves

question.name: Chaos
question.text: Please briefly describe your strategy for this scenario.

question.name: Chaos
question.text: In addition to the 7 variables offered in the Change the System screen (Shape Type, Rain Rate, Paradigm, etc.), were there any others that you would have liked to have been able to change?

question.name: Chaos
question.text: Did you feel like any of the 7 variables did not do what you expected it to do when you changed it? If yes, please explain which one(s) and why you felt this way.

question.name: Chaos
question.text: If you could do this scenario over, is there anything you would do differently?

question.name: Chaos
question.text: Do you feel that your game play style has changed over the course of the game? If so, how?

question.name: Post-Assessment Feedback
question.text: What are the things you found most difficult about this simulation?

question.name: Post-Assessment Feedback
question.text: What are the things you found easiest about this simulation?

question.name: Post-Assessment Feedback
question.text: Is there anything about the simulation that you feel hindered your ability to perform well?

question.name: Post-Assessment Feedback
question.text: Did any external factors affect your ability to perform well (disruptions, noisy environment, need for coffee, etc.)?

question.name: Post-Assessment Feedback
question.text: Do you feel that your performance in the game reflected your ability to think systemically? Why or why not?

question.name: Post-Assessment Feedback
question.text: Was any part of the simulation itself confusing? If yes, please explain.

question.name: Post-Assessment Feedback
question.text: Did you fully understand the simulation tasks, and your objectives as a player? If not, please explain.

question.name: Post-Assessment Feedback
question.text: If there are any other comments you would like to make, please enter them here.
